arm_group.description: Study group I (57 participants) received the continuous training of exercise time.
Study group II (58 participants) received the interval training of exercise time.

brief_summary.textblock:
The exercise time is an important factor among the medical guides for weight loss; however,
      there is still little knowledge about exercise duration paths in middle-aged and older
      women. The present study aimed to determine the effects of the interval training on weight
      loss and lipid profile, and to compare its efficiency with the continuous training.

clinical_study.brief_title: Response Of Weight And Lipid Profile To Exercise Time In Sedentary Overweight/Obese Middle-Aged And Older Women

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants included sedentary women (age 45-75 years) with overweight or obesity (n= 115).
      They were randomly divided into two groups including continuous exercise, and interval
      exercise. The weight assessment parameters including change in weight and body composition,
      blood sample tests were performed pre- and three month post-intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Sedentary lifestyle

          -  Good Health

          -  Weight stability

        Exclusion Criteria:

        *Abnormality or history of Disease

clinical_study.official_title: Response Of Weight And Lipid Profile To Exercise Time In Sedentary Overweight/Obese Middle-Aged And Older Women

overall_official.affiliation: Member of Scientific Board in Physical Education and Sport Sciences
